title: Larger than life: Each generation of kids is becoming bigger than their parents’ generation
text:
They say that as you grow older you tend to shrink and get smaller. I know i’m getting older because i seem to be shrinking and getting smaller and smaller day by day. And then the realisation dawns on me that it’s not that i’m getting smaller and smaller but all the young people i come across are getting larger and larger.

Of almost all the people that Bunny and i know, our friends and our family members, the children are bigger than their parents, the sons taller than their dads, and the daughters taller than their moms, and sometimes even taller than their dads as well.

As those who belong to the mom-and-dad age group can’t all be shrinking and becoming smaller, it must be that today’s kids are growing up to be taller and bigger. Bunny attributes this to genetically modified or nutritionally enriched foodstuff. Almost everything we eat today, from veggies and fruits, to dairy products and processed food, contains various chemicals and other additives, which over time can effect hormonal and other bodily changes.

This was not the case with earlier generations. All the food we ate was natural – we’d call it ‘organic’ now – and the result was that children grew up to be more or less the same size as their parents.

But today’s Generation X should more properly be called Generation XL, as in Extra Large, as practically everyone belonging to it could pass off, height-wise, as a pro All-American basketball player. And what’s got me wondering is when will this generational size increase stop. Will Generation Y, be even bigger than Generation XL, and Generation Z be larger than Generation Y? Will humans keep growing till they become a race of giants, like the Brobdingnagians of Gulliver’s Travels?

One thing’s for sure. With children increasingly growing bigger than their parents, grown-ups shouldn’t be called grown-ups anymore. They should be called grown-downs.
